item.title: Function MultiChat(Msg1, Msg2, Msg3: String): Boolean;
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

Maybe use Arrays so we could check as much chat as we wanted to?

[php]
procedure FindMultiChat(S: array of String);
var
i: Integer;
begin
Result:= False;
If Not FindTextInBox Then Exit;
GetLastChatText(Chat);
Chat:= LowerCase(Chat);
for i:= 0 to GetarrayLength(S)-1 do
begin
if (pos(S[i], Chat) <> 0)then Result := True;
end;
end;
[/php]

not sure if that would work, but something like that

Read full topic

item.title: Function MultiChat(Msg1, Msg2, Msg3: String): Boolean;
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[scar]Function FindTextInBox: Boolean;
Begin
Result:= False;
if (FindColorTolerance(x, y, 16711680, 90, 415, 480, 435, 10)) and (LoggedIn) then Result:= True;
end;

Function NashiMultiChat(Msg1, Msg2, Msg3: String): Boolean;
Var
Chat: String;
Begin
Result:= False;
If Not FindTextInBox Then Exit;
GetLastChatText(Chat);
Chat:= LowerCase(Chat);
If (pos(Msg1, Chat) <> 0) Or (pos(Msg2, Chat) <> 0) Or (pos(Msg3, Chat) <> 0) Then Result:= True;
End;[/scar]

It is way less laggy then searching for each individual word

Read full topic
